page.title: 02HISTORICAL EVENTS I
page.content: 1076 PENENDEN HEATH First recorded trial in English history Archbishop Lanfranc of Canterbury vs Odo (half brother of King William. 1381 WAT TYLER and the Peasant's Revolt The present Union St. was known as Tyler's Lane. The Archbishop's prison at Maidstone was stormed to release John Ball the "poor priest". 1419 Henry V orders 7000 stone cannon balls from Maidsone quarries. They were used against the French. 1450 JACK CADE'S REBELLION The people of Maidstone take a leading part which threatened London. 1554 WYATT'S REBELLION There was anger at Queen Mary's marriage to Phillip of Spain. Maidstone lost its Charter as a result
